title: How to Check if a Remote Control is Transmitting an Infrared Signal

steps.title: Gather up all the remote controls that you think are not working and a digital camera or cell phone with a camera.
steps.content: Gather up all the remote controls that you think are not working and a digital camera or cell phone with a camera.

steps.title: Turn the digital camera on, all you need to do is look at is the digital screen while performing the process.
steps.content: Turn the digital camera on, all you need to do is look at is the digital screen while performing the process.

steps.title: No need for turning off all the lights (but may be helpful in seeing the IR signal).
steps.content: No need for turning off all the lights (but may be helpful in seeing the IR signal).

steps.title: Point the remote towards the lens of the camera as you would when pointing the remote towards the TV.
steps.content: Point the remote towards the lens of the camera as you would when pointing the remote towards the TV.

steps.title: Press and hold any button on the remote while viewing the screen on the camera.
steps.content: Press and hold any button on the remote while viewing the screen on the camera. Note: some buttons may not transmit signals via default. Best button to try first is the power button.

steps.title: While holding the button on the remote and viewing the digital camera screen if you see a blueish light, that means the infrared signal is working properly, there is a problem with the direct connection (if it's a universal remote, try setting it up, if its not, you're probably not pointing it correctly).
